worklogs.comment:
bkietz commented on pull request #3781: ARROW-3550: [C++] use kUnknownNullCount for the default null_count argument
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3781
 
 
   Previous default for this parameter in Array constructors was 0, which is not correct for all bitmaps the array might've been constructed with.
   
   Sidecar: corrected `TypeTraits<NullType>` to reflect that it is parameter free and has a type_singleton.

wesm commented on pull request #3781: ARROW-3550: [C++] use kUnknownNullCount for the default null_count argument
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3781#discussion_r263147937
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/array-test.cc
 ##########
 @@ -73,6 +73,10 @@ TEST_F(TestArray, TestNullCount) {
 
   std::unique_ptr<Int32Array> arr_no_nulls(new Int32Array(100, data));
   ASSERT_EQ(0, arr_no_nulls->null_count());
+
+  std::unique_ptr<Int32Array> arr_default_null_count(
+      new Int32Array(100, data, null_bitmap));
+  ASSERT_EQ(kUnknownNullCount, arr_default_null_count->data()->null_count);
 
 Review comment:
   Yes this works for me! Thanks =)

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
Currently, the default value in the NumericArray constructor for the null_count is 0.

I wonder wether it would be better to use kUnknownNullCount instead? A user could still choose to supply a null_count of 0, or a nullptr as bitmask which would imply a null_count of 0 as well.

comments.body: Sounds OK to me. In {{Array::null_count()}}, if the count is unknown and the validity bitmap is null, then it is set to 0
Can you submit a patch for this?
